Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: That is not the missing start button that is being addressed and the one being added is on the ARM based RT start screen. That is where people want the start button (the screen with the tiles). The desktop you are talking about is the old version of Windows running underneath on X86 chips. That is essentially the same as W7. That start button DOES NOT HAVE ANY FUNCTIONALITY TIED TO THE ARM RT (top layer of Windows 8 "Tiles". It is only a link back to the runtime that operates on ARM chips. If you right click it, you have links to the old x86 chips of W7 like the desktop (control panel, etc) of the DESKTOP ONLY. It is NOT A START BUTTON FOR RT W8 ARM. They may be adding a start button on the left of the tile screen that says Start Button and has the Windows logo above it. This will provide shortcuts to things on the arm layer. There are two different layers on Windows 8 professional PC's (Arm & X86. There is only one layer on Windows RT only machines. The people that want a start button are referring to the Windows RT only machines or the Arm layer of the professional machines. The only start button on the professional machines only accesses the old desktop layer which is identical to W7. They want a start button on the screen with the tiles and there are a whole series of machines that do not have the desktop on it only the ARM RT layer.

Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: "ARM based RT start screen" PC users, desktop or laptop don't care ARM based RT start screen: Windows RT (codenamed Windows on ARM) is a version of Microsoft Windows operating system designed to run on mobile devices. wikipedia

Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: There is one way the start button does work for the Arm (tile layer) runtime if you right click the start button. If you click search you can search the arm layer. Not exactly a start button for arm but you can search for anything you want as long as you change the search between apps, files, etc. People do not want to search for things though, that is why they want a real start button on the arm layer. It is good that you did not know there are two layer though. That means they are doing a pretty good job of making it one machine. It is revolutionary as Microsoft was the first to combine the Arm type chip experience of the Apple, etc with a traditional PC experience. Best of both world on one machine. You will never have an easy transition when doing that kind of innovation.

Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: Search? The 1st time I ran w8 I had to search for SHUTDOWN. No problem, i made a desktop icon C:\Windows\System32\shutdown.exe -s -t 00 for a 1 click SHUTDOWN like my w7. tHEN i SET UP W8 EXACTLY LIKE I HAD W7 SET UP, i scrolled the system 32 folder and created a shortcut for every msft program in it and placed them in a desktop folder with 1 click access to all of them. As a result i've never had to search help or use the charms bar, which i disabled with a simple registry command. As a result I have a O/S faster, safer and stronger than w7. If your mobile device don't have a start button, that's tough, but don't tell me the w8 I have on 4 pc's don't have a start button when I'm looking at it as I am typing this.

Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: That's nice that you are looking at them. It is also fine if you do not understand that the arm and x86 are separate layers accessing separate chips. So the start button does not help those that want the functionality of the old start button on the arm layer Windows RT. That is what will be added. If the current start button for the desktop x86 old layer floats your boat fine. For all the people complaining about no start button on the ARM RT runtime it will be coming on the main start screen and will be the first thing you see on the left hand screen centered and will say START BUTTON. There will be no other tiles in that row only the Start Button that will be added to the RT runtime.

Message.Title: Digitimes Research: Global tablet shipments in 1Q13 down sequentially, up on year....
Message.Msg: Sounds like all the noise about Tablets destroying PCs is a pile of BS... "There were 31.93 million tablets shipped globally during the first quarter of 2013, decreasing on quarter by 26.1% but increasing on year by 66.1%, according to figures collected by Digitimes Research. The shipments consisted of 19.5 million iPads and 12.43 non-iPad devices, slipping on quarter by 7.1% and 44.1% respectively. In terms of operating system, iOS accounted for 61% of the shipments, Android for 31% and Windows for 8%. In terms of screen size, 7.x-inch models took up 56% of the shipments, 9.x-inch 22%, 10.x-inch 20% and over 11-inch 2% Among international tablet vendors, Apple was the largest accounting for 61.1% of the shipments, followed by Samsung Electronics with 13.8%, Google with 6.1%, Microsoft with 4%, Acer with 3.7%, Asustek Computer with 3%, Barnes & Noble and Lenovo each with 2%, Amazon with less than 1%". AND Surface Pro only was available in a couple of markets for only 6 weeks in Q1/2013. IN May 2013, we will start selling Surface Pro in over 30 countries. Cheers Osso

Topic.Title: Microsoft announces an update & CNBC has to drum up a Slam Job on W8 - It's an update you idiots

Message.Msg: There are two Surfaces One running on RT ARM and the other intel i5 x86 Surface pro. A surface RT laptop is not a mobile device like you say an it runs on ARM. The Surface pro x86 version start button only access desktop features it will not locate tiles on the start screen unless you do it via search. We will have to agree to disagree. I have developers software and have a few things you do not. Do you really think you have a start button no one else has and all the people requesting the start button for the "TILES START SCREEN" don't. Like I said, since I am a programmer/developer I have the development software. I see the button you are referring to, we are just disagreeing on what it does and you do not understand the differences in the Windows 8 RT & Windows 8 Professional versions. Rt = Arm Professional = x86 version via Intel i5 or i7. Microsoft is not the only company making RT Arm only devices. Samsung makes a RT tablet that they hacked a full function of start button into without permission. That is not a Microsoft start button, it is hacked Samsung. I also tested a Samsung Professional version of a tablet and that also has the hacked version of the start button. What I mean by hacked is that is not in the Windows 8 program, it is in the framework of the Samsung machine. So Samsung tablets have a start button that is different. Those machines may have been halted from sale. I am not sure. There was an attempted injunction not from Microsoft but in reference to Apple patents. If you want the start button look at the Samsung Tablets. The are numerous RT ARM versions and Professional X86 versions. Every manufacturer has some it seems. Samsung was the only brand I tested that had a start button hacked into it that operated like the old W7 start button. W8 start button just accesses desktop features only.

Message.Title: Bloomberg: Jobless Claims in U.S. Unexpectedly Fall to Five-Year Low THANKS OBAMA & DEMS!!
Message.Msg: Jobless Claims in U.S. Unexpectedly Fall to Five-Year Low By Alex Kowalski - May 9, 2013 7:48 AM CT Facebook Share Tweet LinkedIn Google +1 18 Comments Print QUEUEQ The number of Americans filing claims for jobless benefits unexpectedly dropped last week to the lowest level in more than five years, a signal employers are confident enough in the economic outlook to hold onto workers. Applications for unemployment insurance payments decreased by 4,000 to 323,000 in the week ended May 4, the least since January 2008, Labor Department figures showed today. Economists forecast 335,000 claims, according to the median estimate in a Bloomberg survey. For the first time, the average over the past month was the lowest since before the last recession began. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: THE BUSH/REPUBLICAN NIGHTMARE IS OVER. Message.Title: Huawei's First Windows Phone 8 Smartphone Lands in U.S. (Source Bloomberg)
Message.Msg: "We are proud to deliver a premium smartphone experience to customers at a competitive price point," said Todd Greenberg, General Manager, US Windows Phone Sales at Microsoft. "The new Huawei W1 is a great addition to the Windows Phone 8 portfolio of devices in the U.S. with its impressive battery life and availability in Walmart stores." The Huawei W1 features a speedy 1.2GHz dual-core processor, optimized battery technology, a gorgeous 4'' IPS LCD touch screen made of Gorilla® glass that looks great even in sunlight, and 5MP camera with 0.3MP front-facing camera, LED flash, 4X digital zoom, auto focus and a quick access button. Powered by Windows Phone 8, the device offers a truly personal smartphone experience to fit unique needs and provide quick access to the people and things customers care about most.

Message.Title: Will code name "Durango" aka XBOX 720 push this stock higher
Message.Msg: Who knows how the box could change as it is only being announced on the 21st but will not be available to probably the "usual" before the holiday's. Is it an Xbox or a 64 bit 1.6 gh 8 core w/a hard drive running Windows 8. Yes, running Windows 8 & AMD chips. Will it have and HDMI input cable pass through for guess what allowing your cable or internet TV connection. Your TV is going to get pretty cool pretty quick. So now you will have a Windows Phone, Surface and Xbox all running Windows 8. Should not just say Surface better to say every manufacturer and his brother making Windows 8 devices. Don't forget the 7 inch tablet coming that guess what will run Windows 8. There is going to be a lot of fun going on man. The XBOX experience is on the Windows 8 phone & operating systems already. Now the missing link of hooking it up to your tv, cable and enjoying the Blu Ray. It has wifi so if you do not have a tv with a HDMI Input or cable you can still access the internet. Looks like Windows 8 it sure bringing a lot of new things despite the haters trying to hate it. Now you will have the ultimate Multi Media experience with Internet/Cable/Tv. Those HDMI cables can cost a lot of money at some of these places. I just bought one for $40.00 or $50.00 that was for high something or other. That is kind of crazy. Oh, I hope they can get all this going by Christmas for Durango and not 2014 ver. I know the cell phone guys wait for announce dates and then 1 up them. Nokia announces a Window's look alike Asha phone today (Wonder how mr softy felt about that?) and Amazon announces a 3d phone on the same day. Facebook reduces Home phones to .99 cents. I have a feeling Google TV & Sony will announce something around the 21st to rival the Xbox 720. Seems that is the way companies roll in 2013.

Message.Msg: Oh yea, how about I tell you the secrets of myself creating my own Start Button by adding programs or anything else I want to that menu. You should not try it as you may mess your computer up. Hold the Windows Key down & Press R Type Regedit Click HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT CLICK EDIT HEADINT DROP DOWN TO FIND TYPE SHELLEX RIGHT CLICK CONTEXTMENUHANDLERS SELECT NEW KEY ERASE THE NAME AND RENAME IT TO THE KEY OR PROGRAM YOU WANT. I WILL DO A MOVE SO I TYPE MOVE OR IN YOUR CASE MOVEDUMBAXS HIGHLIGHT MOVEDUMBAXS RIGHT CLICK ON DEFAULT ON THE SCREEN NEXT TO IT IN THE VALUE DATA TYPE {C2FBB631-2971-11D1-A18C-00C04FD75D13} HIT EXIT THAN THE MOVE DUMBAXS CAN BE SEEN IN THE MENU WHEN YOU RIGHT CLICK ON THE FILE. THE WAYS TO MAKE A COMPLETE CUSTOM START BAR TO INCLUDE PICTURES, MEDIA PLAYER, YOUR FAVORITE PROGRAMS ARE DONE IN THE REGISTRY EDITER SIMILIAR TO THE ABOVE. THERE YOU GO DUMBAXS

Message.Title: Why 100 Million Windows 8 Licenses Isn't Impressive
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "By Evan Niu, CFA "May 9, 2013 | Comments (0) "Software giant Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT ) made headlines earlier this week when it boasted 100 million license sales of Windows 8 since the controversial new platform launched six months ago. Microsoft also outlined its plan to release a public preview of Windows 8.1, codenamed "Blue," which may address some of the platform's weaknesses. "That's up from the 60 million figure that Microsoft touted in January. That's also roughly the same pace that the flagship operating system's predecessor saw when Windows 7 was unleashed upon the world back in 2009. "Keep in mind that these figures that Microsoft shares are based on sell-in to its distribution channel, which includes sales to retailers and OEMs. Some of these licenses are sold directly to end users, including upgrades, but most people generally don't buy copies of Windows directly. "When it comes to actual sell-through and consumer usage, Microsoft is likely doing much worse than its statistics would suggest. Moor Insights & Strategy principal analyst Patrick Moorhead estimates that 41% of those Windows 8 licenses aren't in play right now." ____________________________________ I and others have pointed this out before, but it's worthwhile pointing out that it's not just us who know it.

You cannot innovate when the gov. is saying they can put you in cuffs & pull-ups, etc. That is how Microsoft fell behind, they were halted by the GOV. Now is a new day and they innovated and it is up to the street to get behind the stock. You can hate on them all you want. That is really what happened.

Message.Title: WHY Windows will win this round as well....
Message.Msg: Folks let's face it Windows is the closest thing to a Monopoly and then comes AAPL and malware infested Android wannabe's.... You see change is hard and in IT is next to impossible and as our detractors have proven by their constant Windows-8 bashing for "removing the start button", there is no way CIOs are going to change 30 years of training and database management and go buy into a new OS.... Steve Jobs understood that, so he positioned Mac for consumers, small businesses and some specialty trade like Graphics et al.... Then he came up with his big idea, the Tablet, capitalizing on his iPhone base and started the "Death of PC" gimmick and the cheerleaders on Wall Street took his song and created a false doomsday scenario (Kind of like Y2K BS and the End of Times nonsense).... SO Mr. Softy was a bit late to the show and decided to really stick it to the Death of the PC crowd and decided to "Integrate Desktop with Mobility"; and we are in the final stretch of killing Steve Job's Clever but False bet. Don't get me wrong, I like Steve Jobs as an innovator, but a shrewd and dirty player in business and am surprised to see how the Google boys used him and his ideas and screwed him at the end (whatever comes around goes around and the Google boys will get their chance to get screwed by someone more devious than them). AT any rate, we will dominate the Desktop and Mobility now that more Hardware folks are on board with Windows Phones, Tablets and Convertible Laptops. Cheers Osso

Message.Msg: RACISM: Heritage policy analyst thinks Hispanics are gentically inferior Jason Richwine, formerly with the American Enterprise Institute and currently a Senior Policy Analyst at the Heritage Foundation, where he co-authored a report claiming that immigration reform would damage the US economy, wrote the following in his Ph.D. dissertation: The average IQ of immigrants in the United States is substantially lower than that of the white native population, and the difference is likely to persist over several generations. ... the totality of the evidence suggests a genetic component to group differences in IQ. ... No one knows whether Hispanics will ever reach IQ parity with whites, but the prediction that new Hispanic immigrants will have low-IQ children and grandchildren is difficult to argue against. From the perspective of Americans alive today, the low average IQ of Hispanics is effectively permanent. The K0CH BROS OWN BOTH THE HERITAGE FOUNDATION AND THE AMERICAN INTERPRISE INSTITUE. THEY ARE THE LEADING FUNDING SOURCE OF THE REPUBLICAN PARTY.

Message.Title: Lenovo confirms Windows Phone 8 handset plans (Source ZDNet - Jan 2013)....
Message.Msg: "A senior Lenovo executive has again reiterated the Chinese company is planning for a Windows Phone 8 handset and, should the plans be approved, consumers have a "good chance" of seeing it released this year. JD Howard, vice president of business operations & worldwide business development at Lenovo's Mobile Internet and Digital Home (MIDH) business group, told ZDNet Asia in an interview here that as a device manufacturer, the company will go where the market leads in terms of deciding which operating system (OS) to include in its handsets. Android is currently "very solid" and Lenovo is riding the OS' success with the latest portfolio of six phones it unveiled at this year's Consumer Electronics Show (CES), including its flagship K900 smartphone and the enterprise-ready IdeaPhone P770, he said. However, Howard said should consumers be concerned over any possible security vulnerabilities in Android OS, or that the phones are made in China, the security features in Windows Phone 8 should help mitigate many of their fears. This is why the MIDH unit has put in a proposal to develop smartphones running Windows Phone 8 OS to the management, given that it is Lenovo's planning cycle now. He said its fiscal year ends in March 2013, and any concrete decisions will only be known in April. That said, should the management give the greenlight, there is a "good chance" consumers will see a Lenovo-branded Windows Phone 8 handset in 2013, the vice president stated". SO folks now that Huawei has unveiled their WP-8, next up is Lenovo. Cheers Osso

Romney went to Harvard Law Schol, and didn't learn something every average person knows to do, verify? Amazing incompetence. The President was concerned with announcing a tragedy where lives were lost, and that we will never give in to terrorism. The terrorists will be found, and he wasn't remotely talking about the guy who made the video. That has to be the most stupid idea a human brain could come up with. The President has never alluded to or in any way stated we have eliminated al qaeda, so he is not protecting any statement. That's another beyond stupid comment the rwnjs come up with. They are coming up with this stuff themselves, the rwnjs, none of it has any resemblance to what the President says or does.
